Authors:
Johannes (Ewald) Zacharias Groenewald, Cecelia Rego, Helena
Oliveira, Ana Cabral, Pedro W. Crous
Title:
Cylindrocarpon root rot: multi-gene analysis reveals novel
species within the Ilyonectria radicicola species complex
Keywords:
Cylindrocarpon root rot, Nectria-like fungi, Phylogeny,
Systematics
Abstract:
Ilyonectria radicicola and its Cylindrocarpon-like
anamorph represent a species complex that is commonly associated with
root rot disease symptoms on a range of hosts. During the course of this
study, several species could be distinguished from I. radicicola sensu
stricto based on morphological and culture characteristics. DNA sequence
analysis of the partial β-tubulin, histone H3, translation elongation
factor 1-α and nuclear ribosomal RNA-Internal Transcribed Spacer
(nrRNA-ITS) genes were employed to provide further support for the
morphological species resolved among 68 isolates associated with root
rot disease symptoms. Of the various loci screened, nrRNA-ITS sequences
were the least informative, while histone H3 sequences were the most
informative, resolving the same number of species as the combined
dataset across the four genes. Within the Ilyonectria radicicola species
complex, 12 new taxa are delineated occurring on a diverse range of
hosts, the most common being Cyclamen, Lilium, Panax, Pseudotsuga,
Quercus and Vitis.
